PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF8172 - vSphere Client Roadmap: Host Client, HTML5 Client, and Web Client
PresentationDetailsList.Description: This session covers all things VMware vSphere UI. VMware has been working hard at bringing improvements to the vSphere management interfaces. We will cover the progress that the host client, HTML5 client, and Web client have made recently and provide a tech preview of upcoming improvements.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF8396 - Winter Is Coming. Are You Dev/Ops Ready? Instant Clone Is!
PresentationDetailsList.Description:
Instant Clone gives customers the ability to fork hundreds of virtual machines instantly with minimal resource overhead. It is what you need for moving to a new paradigm of "just-in-time" provisioning.
In this session, you will get to know all the updates we have been working on since the previous VMworld. We will share performance and feature updates and how easy it is to use them. We will address how Instant Clone can be consumed for the Dev/Ops and Dev/Test use cases with Chef/Puppet integrations.
We will also have a customer come on stage to showcase how they are planning on using these features within their environment.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF8755R - Troubleshooting vSphere 6: Tips and Tricks for the Real World
PresentationDetailsList.Description: VMware vSphere is the industry-leading virtualization platform. Understanding how to use critical troubleshooting techniques is key to improving the performance and reliability of your vSphere environment. Join us for a deep dive and explore troubleshooting tools that include the use of the vSphere Command Line Interface, the VMware ESXi shell, and log files to diagnose and correct problems. We will also explore specific commands you can use to resolve networking and storage issues as well as vSphere High Availability cluster and performance issues.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF8383 - Maximizing Your Remote Site Infrastructure with vSphere and Virtual SAN
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Managing a few data centers with thousands of servers is a relatively well-understood scenario, but try managing hundreds or thousands of remote office/branch sites with tens of thousands of servers distributed across the country or around the globe. This is a common challenge that many retailers, manufacturers, and healthcare providers deal with on a regular basis. During this popular session, you'll learn about how features of VMware vSphere and VMware Virtual SAN combine to give you the most solid, secure, and cost-effective remote site infrastructure possible. Explore vSphere and Virtual SAN ROBO site implementation best practices for deployment, lifecycle management, configuration/compliance, and monitoring/troubleshooting. Join us for an extremely informative, exciting, and interactive session.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: MGT8040 - Turning Up the Noise: How VMware's Private Cloud Team Is Getting Closer to the Heartbeat of Its Infrastructure, Billions of Events at a Time
PresentationDetailsList.Description:
Let's face it, logs are often unruly, nasty creatures, and the last thing we want is to be overwhelmed with more noise as we manage our visibility and usability goals. Logs are like blood to a surgeon: It's absolutely critical that they be in the correct places and in manageable quantities, otherwise chaos erupts. Learn how VMware's Private Cloud team is working toward enabling debug-level logging in our main environment and how we sized for the increased log flow and storage cost and reduced unnecessary noise to allow us to stretch our retention schedule and storage budget. We will:
1. Share code
2. Demonstrate how to manage the logging configuration for each environment's devices from a single user interface
3. Enforce configuration compliance of our many VMware vRealize Log Insight servers using the newly available configuration representational state transfer (REST) APIs
4. Discuss how we easily secure the transmission of our logs from the endpoint through multiple levels of logging servers. The benefits of the additional logging both have huge potential in isolating issues and give VMware engineering unparalleled visibility into VMware product performance at scale.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF8631 - VMware Certificate Management for Mere Mortals
PresentationDetailsList.Description: SSL certificates have become essential in securing access to our data centers and infrastructure. As VMware vSphere has evolved, so too have the processes, applications, and management of SSL certificates. Gone are the days of simply relying on self-signed certificates and never having to validate, renew, or really manage those certificates. In this session, we will discuss and demonstrate the new VMware Certificate Authority to show how to deploy and manage SSL certificates in vSphere 6. We'll also discuss upgrade considerations and how to evaluate the different deployment models for the VMware Certificate Authority in order to decide which is best for the user's organization.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF8374 - Zero Downtime, 20K+ VMware vSphere 6 Upgrade
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Limiting downtime in a large-scale VMware vSphere environment has its own challenges, regardless of the industry. In healthcare IT, downtime doesn't just mean lost dollars or lost productivity. It can mean lost lives and grieving families. As vSphere versions get out of date or approach the end of support, keeping old infrastructure running just gets more difficult. HCA is the largest for-profit healthcare management corporation in the country. Its vSphere environment consists of around 1,000 hosts and 25,000 virtual machines. Until Q1 2016, HCA had been running vSphere 5.0 as a standard. With the end of support for 5.0 coming in August, that operating standard was no longer an option. With zero tolerance for downtime at this scale, it was vital that a simple but thorough process be developed to upgrade HCA's vSphere environment to 6.0. This session will discuss the challenges HCA faced with their scale and the looming end of support date for vSphere 5.0. Also, we will spend time identifying and explaining the process methodologies that were developed to ensure an upgrade path with no unplanned downtime. Beyond having the vSphere infrastructure upgraded, aligned, and consistent, there were greater benefits realized from this project, including fundamental changes in the view of lifecycle management in the vSphere environment. We will also explore how multiple, quantized standards within the vSphere environment can allow for a greater ability to adapt and react to end of support deadlines and changes in vSphere architecture. Presenters will include HCA's assistant vice president of infrastructure and operations, engineering and operational resources, and its dedicated enterprise technical account manager.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF8845 - vSphere Logs Grow Up! Tech Preview of Actionable Logging with vRealize Log Insight
PresentationDetailsList.Description:
Logging of actions in the VMware vSphere environment is key to running a secure infrastructure. With VMware vRealize Log Insight for vCenter you can monitor many things out of the box.
But wouldn't you like to know more than just "virtual machine reconfigured?" What exactly was changed? Is it something I have to worry about?
This session will introduce you to a technology preview of enhanced, or "actionable," logging in vSphere. Used in conjunction with vRealize Log Insight you will really see the value of just what can be done with actionable logging

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF8038r - Getting Started with PowerShell and PowerCLI for Your VMware Environment (Copy)
PresentationDetailsList.Description: VMware PowerCLI Module is one of the most complete, mature, and widely adopted extensions to the PowerShell framework. It includes a plethora of functions that abstract the vSphere API down to simple and powerful cmdlets for operating your vSphere environment. For those new to the concepts of scripting and automation, getting your feet wet into PowerCLI can be daunting. After all, no one wants to accidentally explode their data center with a few errant keystrokes! Join VMware Kyle Ruddy, Senior Technical Marketing Engineer, along with Rubrik Chris Wahl, Microsoft PowerShell MVP, as they arm you for success with PowerShell and PowerCLI. You’ll learn how modules, snapins, functions, and scripts relate to one another, how to install and configure your PowerShell Integrated Scripting Environment, setup a profile, and begin writing PowerCLI scripts using safe, non-destructive starter code. We’ll also dive into exploring objects, extension data, and perform simple logic statements.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF9128 - Day 2 Operations: A vCenter Server Administrator's Diary
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Deploying the VMware vCenter Server Appliance is only the first part to the vCenter Server lifecycle. In this session, you'll get to peek into the real-world experiences of operating the vCenter Server Appliance throughout its entire lifecycle. We'll discuss stories from our own experiences as well as those of customers we've worked with. We'll chronicle the tasks and operations that vCenter Server administrators need to know to be more effective and efficient when working with the vCenter Server Appliance. We'll also take a look at some of the tools that we've used to manage and troubleshoot the vCenter Server Appliance. Finally, we'll talk about upgrade planning and what you need in order to have a successful upgrade to VMware vSphere 6 and beyond.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF8693 - How to Get the Most out of Your VMware Investment: Leveraging vSphere to Reduce Total Cost of Ownership
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Sometimes it's easy to forget just what sped the adoption of server virtualization several years ago - server consolidation drove businesses and organizations to convert physical workloads quickly. Some gas and electric companies even offered rebates for virtualization and server consolidation projects. Now, with many businesses achieving virtualization ratios of 90 percent or more, they might assume they've achieved all the savings that can be offered from their hypervisor - but is that truly the case? In this session, we will discuss the hypervisor and the role it played in transforming not only the data center, but also what businesses and organizations have achieved because of it. We'll then talk about the all-important VM-to-host density ratio and how to make sure you're packing the most VMs that you can onto each cluster. Not only does the hypervisor provide tangible savings by itself, it's also the foundation of the Software-Defined Data Center (SDDC), and we'll discuss how it can be leveraged to virtualize other components in a data center—thus improving savings and reducing TCO. Last but not least, we'll take a look at the oftentimes unnoticed but extremely important topic of OpEx and dive into how the SDDC can provide incredible efficiencies and savings as well as how it can accelerate the rate of innovation and development.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF8251 - vSphere Host Fabric: Why It Matters to You?
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Are you having difficulty navigating industry trends like NVMe versus NVM, DAS versus Fabric, 100G fabric, RDMA versus DPDK, overlay networks versus SDN, offloads—stateless versus statefull, and composable hardware? Are you wondering how it all fits together in your infrastructure for your workloads? This session will introduce the investments we are making in various VMware vSphere—driven fabric and technologies and how they can benefit your infrastructure and applications. We'll also present a review of how these key capabilities align with the recent technological advancements across various industry segments. The session will conclude with a high-level overview of some of the more recent developments in the field of interconnect technologies and VMware's plans for the future.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF8108 - Extreme Performance Series: vCenter Performance Deep Dive
PresentationDetailsList.Description: The VMware vCenter Server is at the heart of your cloud deployment. You need high responsiveness, the ability to accommodate rapid provisioning of virtual machines and applications, and resiliency. While the out-of-the-box settings should work great for all of you, we recognize that there is no single best configuration for everyone. In this talk, we will help you get the most out of vCenter Server from a performance perspective. We will examine the vCenter Server in detail and provide best practices for performance and scale. We start with a refresher course on vCenter Server internals and describe the various functional pieces that make up vCenter Server, starting with vCenter Server 6.0 and providing some insights on future directions. We move on to discuss issues that may impact performance of either vCenter Server or the Web client—for example, interactions between vCenter Server and its database, Java service settings inside vCenter Server, and interactions with applications like VMware vRealize Operations Manager or VMware NSX. We then discuss the salient differences between vCenter Server for Windows and the vCenter Server Appliance. We also describe enhancements that allow larger cluster sizes and higher operational throughput. Finally, we look ahead to future architectural directions that will further enhance the performance and usability of vCenter Server for 2016 and beyond.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF8379 - Virtualization 101
PresentationDetailsList.Description: New to virtualization? Just getting started setting up VMware vSphere or trying to sell vSphere for the first time? This session is an introduction into the key technologies and market dynamics around virtualization. Each year, we see more and more new customers and partners who are trying to get a better handle on our core technology. This breakout is a great place to start and can also serve as a quick refresh.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF8371 - How Did the Private Cloud Transform VMware IT?
PresentationDetailsList.Description: VMware's internal private cloud was conceptualized due to a requirement for a world-class, highly available, agile infrastructure as a service platform to meet VMware's ever-growing business application portfolio demands. The internal private cloud transformed the way IT operates. This transition to IT as a business has positioned IT operations as a service provider, with its own profit-and-loss center that builds and operates a private cloud. The internal private cloud moved VMware from virtualization to a private cloud and completely changed the way IT operates. The internal private cloud was built as a business with multidimensional goals of availability, agility, cost, and VMware on VMware. The internal private cloud has enabled VMware's research and development team to releases products in a more agile way.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF8045 - vSphere High Availability Best Practices and Tech Preview
PresentationDetailsList.Description: In this session, we cover VMware vSphere High Availability (HA) best practices, ensuring you with the practices and settings that provide the highest availability possible for your virtual machines and applications. This historically well-attended session will also take a deep dive into the inner workings of vSphere HA and will spend a great deal of time on tech preview features, which won't disappoint. Don't miss out on HA best practices. This is a session you won't want to miss!

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF8375 - What's New with vSphere
PresentationDetailsList.Description: A VMworld staple! Come find out what's new with the most robust and adopted virtualization platform in the industry. This session provides a high-level overview of existing/new features, direction updates and changes, tech previews, and other critical data points (such as end-of-support reminders) that will help you stay on top of VMware vSphere in 2016. Don't miss your chance to get the latest and greatest details on vSphere.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF9144 - Through the Looking Glass:  An Overview of the vCenter Server Appliance Management Interface and API
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Is your VMware vCenter Server Appliance too much of a blackbox? Learn how to monitor and manage your vCenter Server Appliance and Postgres database while enjoying the benefits of simplicity with appliances—the best of both worlds.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: MGT9997-SPO - How to Automate Cloud Operations with vRealize and NSX Featuring Lessons Learned from Deluxe Corp’s Transformation
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Automation and orchestration are critical to managing cloud operations at scale. Join us as we discuss how and why you can simplify cloud delivery and management with converged infrastructure and managed cloud services that improve infrastructure automation, orchestration and advanced monitoring capabilities. Join this session to learn how to (1) Deploy scalable cloud operations using vRealize suite, (2) Deliver self-service access to infrastructure and applications catalog, and (3) Enable policy-based provisioning and management of network functions using NSX. This is also your opportunity to leverage the lessons learned by Deluxe Corp. as they continue their transformation to increase the automation and orchestration in their cloud. Dan Bozicevich Director, Infrastructure Technologies from Deluxe Corporation will join us to discuss how they are leveraging VMware and Hitachi Converged Infrastructure to introduce policy-driven private cloud operations for on-demand delivery of IT services.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF8858 - vSphere Identity: Multifactor Authentication Deep Dive
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Identity is the cornerstone of infrastructure management, and VMware empowers your VMware identities across the data center. Multifactor authentication used to be relegated to VPN login. Now it's everywhere, from Facebook to WordPress. It is well understood now that username and password is not enough. This session will cover the new authentication options present in VMware vSphere 6 update 2. We will go over the setup and configuration of RSA SecurID and smart card authentication.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF8683 - Understanding the Role SNMP Agents Play in a vSphere Stack
PresentationDetailsList.Description: In this session, you will meet with the principal developer of the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) -related subsystems in the VMware vSphere stack. You'll also learn about the specific SNMP agents provided in VMware ESXi since version 5.1, in VMware vCenter Server since 4.0, and in VMware vCenter Server Appliance since 6.0.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF9048 - An Architect's Guide to Designing Risk: The VCDX Methodology
PresentationDetailsList.Description:
This presentation provides an architect's perspective of how risk affects design decisions.

Following the VCDX methodology, this deep dive looks at how a large number of variables can affect the logical design of an infrastructure. 

Anything that is unknown or unsure can be considered a risk. The criticality and probability of those risks can determine the likelihood of success or failure.

Risk management is normally under the purview of security or compliance and comes down to the architect as a set of controls, which dictates the overarching parameters for the design.

This presentation argues that an architect equipped with the knowledge and tools of the risk management practice can virtually guarantee the success (or foresee failure) of any design before it has started.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF8469 - iSCSI/iSER: HW SAN Performance Over the Converged Data Center
PresentationDetailsList.Description:
The iSCSI protocol enables users to deploy SCSI storage over the converged data center fabric. However, since iSCSI uses TCP, it incurs the overheads associated with software protocol processing. The iSCSI Extensions for RDMA (iSER) protocol conducts iSCSI data movement over RDMA, which provides high-bandwidth data transfers while bypassing the CPU; nevertheless, the iSCSI control plane and extensive management infrastructure are preserved. With the advent of native RDMA support, VMware ESXi now supports the creation of iSER initiators and their registration with iSCSI transport layer, paving the way for efficient, high-performance shared storage in the virtual cloud. 

This session provides an in-depth technology preview and evaluation of iSER for ESXi. First, we will review the iSCSI datapath and its acceleration using iSER. Second, we will describe the implementation of a VMware ESX iSER initiator, based on the RDMA DDK. Finally, we will review typical iSER SAN configurations and demonstrate the significant performance benefits achieved.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF8250 - Case Study: Using vCloud Suite to monitor Global operations
PresentationDetailsList.Description: The world is moving towards Gen 2.5 and Gen 3 type workloads. In this rapidly changing landscape, enterprise IT need to constantly re-invent itself. The session is a deep-dive on actual customer challenges in Datacenter virtualisation / Cloud Operations and how each of these were overcome - includes tips and best practices for fast growing large scale deployments.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF9089 - Managing vCenter Server at Scale? Here's What You Need to Know
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Is your VMware vSphere environment expanding? Are you concerned about the overheard of managing thousands of hosts and hundreds of thousands of virtual machines (VM)? VMware vCenter Server exposes many features and capabilities that can be used to greatly simplify infrastructure management at scale. In this session, we will explore the power of tags, custom attributes, VM templates, vApps, and much more.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF9608-SPO - How to Use Machine Learning to Increase Application Availability
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Big data analytics are crucial to business today, including empowering IT organizations to more efficiently host mission-critical apps in VMware environments. This session will cover how machine learning and predictive analytics can be used to prevent many application downtime issues. It will include a detailed demo of how this works within a vSphere environment, including instant root cause analysis across the stack from the volume up to the VM. We will also share statistical data gathered from an installed base of thousands of systems from the past few years, showing where in the application and infrastructure stack problems usually originate.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: MGT8884 - Our SDDC Journey - See how SDDC transformed IT in just 12 months and changed how we think about “automation” at Johnson & Johnson IT.
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Over past 18 months, Johnson & Johnson and VMware collaborated on the planning, design, deployment, and operationalization of a Software-Defined Data Center across the globe. The solution offersfully-automated virtual machine provisioning, using a wide range of technology and software including vRealize Suite (vRealize Automation, vRealize Orchestrator, vRealize Operation Manager, vRealize LogInsight), VMware NSX, Flash Storage and High-Performance computing platforms. The SDDC environment is the foundation of a modernization strategy based on simplifying and automating server, storage, and networking infrastructure using software-defined technology to enable refresh initiatives without major downtime and eliminate “technology-debt”. We will review the architecture, capabilities of the system and summarize the realized benefits as well as challenges and lessons learned from a large healthcare company. Please join us as we review the SDDC IT Transformation that J&J IT embarked on to re-innovate on-premise private Cloud.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF8939 - Virtual Machine and Application Protection Demystified
PresentationDetailsList.Description: With so many options to choose from—tape, NetBackup, Commvault, VMware snapshots, fault tolerance, array-based snapshots, SRM, stretch cluster, SLV-AFO, and VVol—it can be confusing when trying to pick the correct one. We'll demystify these choices, explain which goes where, and teach you the right tool for the right job.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF9944R - What's New with vCenter Server
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Attend this session to learn the latest with vCenter Server, with a special focus on the vCenter Server Appliance. We'll provide an overview of the features available in vCenter Server with the vSphere 6.0 Update 2 release. We will also show tech previews of exciting new capabilities coming in the future for vCenter Server.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF9205R - Troubleshooting vSphere 6 Made Easy: Expert Talk
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Troubleshooting VMware vSphere is always considered a black art, and most of the customers find it challenging when they run into some hurdles. The aim of this session is to provide the customer with a holistic approach for identifying the effects of the problem, defining the troubleshooting scope, and using a structured approach to help overcome these hurdles. The session will also provide exposure to: 1) important and commonly used troubleshooting tools; 2) finding and interpreting relevant log files for specific issues; 3) troubleshooting examples with real-world scenarios; 4) use cases of vSphere Management Assistant and VMware vRealize Log Insight; and 5) proactively involving and exporting appropriate log files to technical support. A troubleshooting guide designed by the experts in global support services will be distributed to customers at the end of the session.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF8117 - Why Fiserv Deployed Auto Deploy and Why You Should as Well
PresentationDetailsList.Description: In this session, you'll learn how Fiserv was able to achieve a stateless VMware vSphere environment by using VMware vSphere Auto Deploy on the Cisco UCS platform. We will cover the many lessons learned and how we were able to attain a stable and consistent environment because of our use of Auto Deploy. The focus begins with a high-level overview of Fiserv's Auto Deploy design, followed by several considerations and preparations. This includes overall integration into an existing IT environment along with Auto Deploy dependencies, such as host profiles, TFTP, DHCP, and VMware vSphere PowerCLI. Next, the focus will shift to technical details of the configuration process, and and we will show several PowerCLI examples that cover many of the common deployment scenarios. We'll also cover, in detail, Fiserv's day-to-day operations and management of the environment using Auto Deploy, including routine items such as adding additional VMware ESXi hosts, adding drivers, and handling ESXi upgrades. We will conclude with a section on how to troubleshoot Auto Deploy that includes examples of issues we have experienced and how best to optimize your ESXi image using PowerCLI. This session will give attendees the knowledge they need to support an Auto Deploy environment.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF8959 - Extreme Performance Series: DRS Performance Deep Dive—Bigger Clusters, Better Balancing, Lower Overhead
PresentationDetailsList.Description: VMware vSphere Distributed Resource Scheduler has evolved over the years to provide effective placement and load balancing for your vSphere clusters. DRS has a rich set of statistics is tracked in a cluster to help keep your workloads from running short of resources. In this talk, we will discuss the various aspects of DRS that contribute to its performance and effectiveness of its placement decisions. We will also describe the different sections in the DRS Web client interface and how they can be used to customize DRS to one's needs and maximize performance of the cluster. Additionally, we will introduce a couple of tech preview features that further enhance the performance and effectiveness of DRS. The goal is to use real-world scenarios to show how DRS can provide the best performance for any cluster. Some of the key highlights of the DRS tech preview feature: - Much faster virtual machine (VM) management and provisioning operations, - Optimized resource consumption, - Highly effective and efficient placement of VMs, - Highly optimized distribution of load, - Considering network load for VM placement and load balancing, and - The ability to predict VM load to resolve contention early on.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF8701R - vSphere Core 4 Performance Troubleshooting and Root Cause Analysis, Part 2: Disk and Network
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Is your virtual guest experiencing performance problems? In this two-part session, we will explore the proper tools to diagnose the problem in real time, whether it's CPU, RAM, disk, or network resources. We will also teach you how to use ESXTOP and the VMware vSphere Web client to determine whether your issues exist at the virtual guest layer, the VMware ESXi host layer, or the physical resource layer. Part 1 will focus on intrahost compute resources (CPU and RAM). Part 2 will focus on I/O resources (disk and network) and how to determine if storage issues are inside or outside of your ESXi host. Session content is based in part on questions heard most often from vSphere administrators via the VMware training team.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF9950 - Storage at Memory Speed and the Amazing Future of Virtual Non-Volatile Memory
PresentationDetailsList.Description: As we predicted at our session last year, there has been a recent flurry of future product announcements and public disclosures from vendors such as Intel and HPE around non-volatile memory. This technology offers persistence at near memory speeds in large enough capacity to change the storage vs memory paradigm used by databases, analytics, and filesystems. In this session you will hear our technologists' vision of what changes in the data center when byte-addressable non-volatile memory technology removes the storage I/O bottleneck. Learn how VMware is working to ensure vSphere can deliver the improved performance and capacity of NVM with the virtualization benefits of workload agility and optimized consolidation. Chief Platform Architect Richard Brunner will join the presentation to discuss the expected architecture of non-volatile memory in new server platforms and the growing standards for system and application software to exploit it. VMware Fellow Pratap Subrahmanyam will also provide a preview of NVM's potential by demonstrating applications running on virtualized byte-addressable non-volatile memory -- a view inside of VMware's skunk works efforts. We invite data center architects, storage experts, ISVs, and developers of all stripes to share our discoveries and insights in this exciting new technology.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF8856 - vSphere Encryption Deep Dive: Technology Preview
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Encryption has become more than just a "checkbox" in a security story. Current events have brought it to the forefront, and it is now becoming a mandatory requirement in business. In this session, as part of a Technology Preview, we will go deep into encryption of virtual disks and vMotion and most importantly, the managability of such solutions. Security isn't helpful unless it's easy to manage!

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF8780R - vSphere Core 4 Performance Troubleshooting and Root Cause Analysis, Part 1: CPU and RAM
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Is your virtual guest experiencing performance problems? In this two-part session, we will explore the proper tools to diagnose the problem in real time, whether it's CPU, RAM, disk, or network resources. We will also teach you how to use ESXTOP and the VMware vSphere Web client to determine whether your issues exist at the virtual guest layer, the VMware ESXi host layer, or the physical resource layer. Part 1 will focus on intrahost compute resources (CPU and RAM). Part 2 will focus on I/O resources (disk and network) and how to determine if storage issues are inside or outside of your ESXi host. Session content is based in part on questions heard most often from vSphere administrators via the VMware training team.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF9205R - Troubleshooting vSphere 6 Made Easy: Expert Talk
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Troubleshooting VMware vSphere is always considered a black art, and most of the customers find it challenging when they run into some hurdles. The aim of this session is to provide the customer with a holistic approach for identifying the effects of the problem, defining the troubleshooting scope, and using a structured approach to help overcome these hurdles. The session will also provide exposure to: 1) important and commonly used troubleshooting tools; 2) finding and interpreting relevant log files for specific issues; 3) troubleshooting examples with real-world scenarios; 4) use cases of vSphere Management Assistant and VMware vRealize Log Insight; and 5) proactively involving and exporting appropriate log files to technical support. A troubleshooting guide designed by the experts in global support services will be distributed to customers at the end of the session.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: MGT8714-SPO - Creating Automated Self-Service Data Protection with Rubrik and vRealize Automation
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Many organizations have enjoyed the benefits from building a Software-Defined Data Center with VMware vRealize Automation solution. It offers an end-to-end cloud management stack for virtualized workloads that want to take advantage of on-premises and cloud infrastructure. Data protection, however, has long since lagged behind due to its legacy architecture and lack of a robust, RESTful API. In this session, join Eric Shanks, Senior Solutions Architect at AHEAD, and Chris Wahl, Technical Evangelist at Rubrik, as they dive deep into how you can expose policy-driven data protection through PowerShell, vRealize Orchestrator, and vRealize Automation. We’ll show you how to make REST calls through simple and powerful workflows and on-demand scripts. Experience a series of technical demos that showcase how to seamlessly integrate backups, change management, and incident management solutions with your lifecycle management processes.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF8020 - Tech Preview: Enhanced VM Availability Leveraging vCenter and Partner Hardware Integration
PresentationDetailsList.Description: This session is a tech preview of enhanced virtual machine (VM) availability based on a tight integration between VMware vCenter and server vendors. Come see how VMware is working with server vendors to increase VM uptime in the event of a host failure, without requiring a high-availability restart. This technology is something you won't want to miss. We will discuss what this technology is, how it works, and the benefits it can realize and provide a working demo with our hardware partner.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF8644 - Getting the Most out of vMotion: Architecture, Features, Performance and Debugging
PresentationDetailsList.Description:
There are many trends influencing today's data center environment, including the increasing adoption of the software-defined data center, geographically dispersed multisite enterprise environments, and the continued penetration of public cloud usage. As the scope of the virtualized environment continues to grow, the ability to vMotion freely and efficiently across this expanding environment will be a crucial value proposition.
Each VMware vSphere release introduces new vMotion functionality and capabilities to address theemerging technology trends and enable new use cases. vMotion in the latest vSphere releasealso features significant performance enhancements that leverage innovations in storage (NVMe Flash) and network (100Gb Ethernet) space that enable extremely fast migrations suitable for private cloud deployments.
In this session, join engineers from the development and performance teams to get an insider's view of vMotion architecture, cutting-edge features, newly added capabilities, and tools for performance troubleshooting. Performance studies and best practices will be presented for some of the hot topics, including monster virtual machine migrations and long-distance migrations. Finally, take a sneak peek into the future directions for vMotion, including encrypted vMotion and migration to public clouds.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF8097 - Production Is Down and So Are My Tools: Meeting Infrastructure High Availability by Deploying an Out-of-Band Management Cluster, A Customer Evolution
PresentationDetailsList.Description: A large northeastern regional bank is utilizing VMware's Virtual SAN and NSX to support its production environment and meet its high-availability needs. By moving vCenter Server and other third-party management components from its production environment to a Virtual SAN enabled vSphere management cluster, the bank is able to use these critical tools if there is a production outage. Virtual SAN delivers the shared storage capacity and performance that these demanding workloads require. This use case leverages the latest version of vSphere and Virtual SAN 6.2 to take advantage of all-flash arrays, deduplication, compression, and inherited redundancy (distributed RAID 5, VMware's vSphere DRS, High Availability, and Fault Tolerance). NSX will provide security through micro-segmentation and flexibility using VXLAN. Additional redundancy within the data center is achieved by segregating the vSphere cluster by fault domains (for example, splitting hosts into different racks on the other side of the data center).

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF8837 - How to Relocate Your Physical Data Center Without Downtime in a Few Clicks, Thanks to Automation
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Have you ever dreamed of moving your workloads from one physical data center to another without any service disruption? This is, in fact, possible! Moving physical servers to a different location always involves painful logistics and implies downtime and hardware surprises after transportation. Physical relocation is a challenging and complex task that requires a lot of preparation. Moving entire data centers without shutting down any workloads requires proper preparation and execution. Virtualization comes to help in this challenge, as the workload is not directly tied to the underlying physical hardware. VMware vCenter offers native toolkits to execute such complex tasks. However, adding more control and efficiency to the migration process requires additional efforts. During the execution, project managers struggle to provide real-time visibility to management and to the business. The data provided is usually delayed and inaccurate, especially in cases of continuous machine relocations, as the spreadsheets are often manually updated. Using vCenter and VMware vRealize Orchestrator in conjunction with VMware vRealize Operations Manager can provide real-time migration state monitoring and reporting to management and businesses in a transparent manner. vRealize Operations Manager also helps in performance analysis, which is necessary for automated decisions during workflows in order to move the workloads according to their activities. In this presentation, we will demonstrate a solution to run a fully automated migration of an active data center from planning to final execution.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF8122 - A Storage Story: Capacity Management and Performance Planning for Storage Systems in vRealize Operations
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Do you want to know if your LUN is the reason your virtual machines are underperforming? How about understanding the effect of the thin provisioned volumes under your datastores? How do you figure out how many storage shelves to purchase to service a new workload? The VMware vRealize Operations Management Pack for Storage Devices and third-party management packs such as Blue Medora's management packs for NetApp and Nimble Storage extend VMware vRealize Operations to show all aspects of your storage infrastructure. There are many chapters in the storage story. LUN, volume, datastores, and underlying hardware aspects all affect performance. We will show you how to trace storage performance issues from the virtual machine down to the disk. Capacity planning is also critical as you grow your infrastructure to meet business demands. We will also show you how to predict future storage needs while accounting for underlying storage hardware and virtual machine hosted workloads.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF8914 - Mastering the VM Tools Lifecycle in your vSphere Data Center
PresentationDetailsList.Description: VMware Tools are an essential part of VMware vSphere virtual infrastructure, providing optimized drivers and enhanced management capabilities for your workloads. Does it seem like every VM in your software-defined data center is complaining about outdated VM Tools? Would you like to learn best practices for operationalizing the lifecycle management of this critical infrastructure element? There are several different types of tools and six different methods to keep them up to date in a vSphere environment, providing opportunities for automation, separation of responsibility, or coordination with other necessary guest OS patching. Put this guidance into practice today, and learn about upcoming security and manageability enhancements on the roadmap!

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF8926 - Take Control of VMware vSphere Lifecycle Management in Your Software-Defined Data Center
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Software inevitably requires updating. If you are responsible for the software infrastructure that powers your business, then you need to take control of patching and upgrading. Understand the importance of planning upgrade sequences, approaches for operationalizing, and much more as we talk about maintaining your Software-Defined Data Center with VMware vSphere Update Manager. Learn how to go about updating your vSphere infrastructure in an automated fashion, from initial security bulletin assessment to fully patched cluster. Also see previews and demos of capabilities available in a future release and hear about the product roadmap.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF9119 - How to Manage Your Platform Services Controller Like Batman
PresentationDetailsList.Description: The Platform Services Controller is an integral piece of the VMware vCenter Server infrastructure. In this session we'll make sure your utility belt is full of the latest and greatest tools for managing your Platform Services Controller. We'll discuss how to manage, build, and destroy replication partnerships along with troubleshooting and best practices for managing the overall health of your Platform Services Controller. We'll also show you the tools and demonstrate what it takes to make sure you're ready to protect your vCenter Server infrastructure when the villains attack.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF8038r - Getting Started with PowerShell and PowerCLI for Your VMware Environment
PresentationDetailsList.Description: VMware PowerCLI Module is one of the most complete, mature, and widely adopted extensions to the PowerShell framework. It includes a plethora of functions that abstract the vSphere API down to simple and powerful cmdlets for operating your vSphere environment. For those new to the concepts of scripting and automation, getting your feet wet into PowerCLI can be daunting. After all, no one wants to accidentally explode their data center with a few errant keystrokes! Join VMware Kyle Ruddy, Senior Technical Marketing Engineer, along with Rubrik Chris Wahl, Microsoft PowerShell MVP, as they arm you for success with PowerShell and PowerCLI. You’ll learn how modules, snapins, functions, and scripts relate to one another, how to install and configure your PowerShell Integrated Scripting Environment, setup a profile, and begin writing PowerCLI scripts using safe, non-destructive starter code. We’ll also dive into exploring objects, extension data, and perform simple logic statements.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF8525-SPO - Enterprise-Class Cloud Stacks Power Mission-Critical Applications
PresentationDetailsList.Description: General-purpose public clouds try to be all things to all people. But, do you really want to bet your business on them? Attend this session to learn about enterprise-class IaaS: cloud stacks designed and built for mission-critical enterprise applications. Deploy secure, scalable, and performance-guaranteed clouds.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF7818 - Take Virtualization to the Next Level
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Virtualization is a powerful, ubiquitous technology in IT. However, as companies grow in size and complexity, it becomes increasingly challenging for IT to manage a growing virtualized infrastructure. In order for IT to move faster and innovate more rapidly, new game-changing tools and technologies are required. With VMware vSphere with Operations Management, IT can operate data centers much more efficiently than what's available with a standard virtualization platform. Virtualize all applications with confidence. Easily assess health, monitor risk, reclaim capacity, and gain efficiency in your data center. Learn how intelligent operation capabilities and automation enable you to quickly identify, diagnose, and remediate problems. See how other organizations have benefited and gained tremendous value by using vSphere with Operations Management.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: MGT7713 - Intelligent IT Operations Management from Infra to Apps, On-Premises and in The Cloud
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Today, lines of business are putting increasing demands on IT to deliver more in less time, and legacy data center operations cannot meet those demands. What IT needs is a comprehensive solution that provides operational efficiency, performance, and availability, as well unified visibility for the entire environment, both on-premises and in the cloud. VMware vRealize Suite is that solution. It provides performance and availability management for infrastructure and applications, capacity planning and optimization, comprehensive topology analysis, log data analysis, and cost transparency. Join this session to see how vRealize Suite can empower you to manage infrastructure and applications across any cloud to users on any device.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF7825 - vSphere DRS and vRealize Operations: Better Together
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Like a campfire and marshmallows, certain things just go better together. Consider VMware vSphere Distributed Resource Scheduler and vRealize Operations. Independently, they both bring their own value to the data center. Combined, however, they unlock new immediate and future synergies. Recently, the two products have been more tightly integrated to provide better workload placement and load balancing within and across clusters, all while providing easier administration. The integration also unveils a brand new predictive capability in Tech Preview that significantly benefits your virtual machine performance and load balancing. So come to this session and learn how vSphere DRS and vRealize Operations are working better together for your workload management, even while you camp!

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF8459 - VMware Security: How to Meet Your Compliance Objectives Using Cool Technology
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Meeting compliance objectives such as audit reporting, encryption, and strong authentication can be difficult on a repeatable basis. We'll show you how to demonstrate to your auditors, in a repeatable way, that your VMware infrastructure is compliant.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF9151 - Getting to Zero: Zero Downtime, Zero Data Loss with vSphere Fault Tolerance
PresentationDetailsList.Description: In vSphere 6, VMware introduced vSphere Fault Tolerance for multiprocessor virtual machines. Come learn about how to configure your environment to attain optimal performance while maintaining zero downtime and zero data loss for a variety of your mission-critical workloads. We will also discuss the advancements made in interoperability with other parts of your Software-Defined Data Center.

Presenters.Name: Glen Brown, Stanley Black and Decker
Presenters.LastName: Glen Brown, Stanley Black and Decker

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF8275R - How to Manage Health, Performance, and Capacity of Your Virtualized Data Center Using vSphere with Operations Management
PresentationDetailsList.Description: VMware vSphere with Operations Management is the world's most trusted virtualization and management platform, delivering unprecedented availability, efficiency, and performance for infrastructure and applications. It is designed so you can deliver value to your business from day one, get better insights into your IT environment, and improve efficiency with automation while retaining control. This session will provide details on how you can benefit from vSphere with Operations Management and why you absolutely, positively must have it and will give you a demo of the latest features and capabilities via various scenarios and use cases.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF8701R - vSphere Core 4 Performance Troubleshooting and Root Cause Analysis, Part 2: Disk and Network
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Is your virtual guest experiencing performance problems? In this two-part session, we will explore the proper tools to diagnose the problem in real time, whether it's CPU, RAM, disk, or network resources. We will also teach you how to use ESXTOP and the VMware vSphere Web client to determine whether your issues exist at the virtual guest layer, the VMware ESXi host layer, or the physical resource layer. Part 1 will focus on intrahost compute resources (CPU and RAM). Part 2 will focus on I/O resources (disk and network) and how to determine if storage issues are inside or outside of your ESXi host. Session content is based in part on questions heard most often from vSphere administrators via the VMware training team.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: MGT7878r - Using vRealize Suite for Endpoint Monitoring in a Multicloud Environment (Copy)
PresentationDetailsList.Description: An endpoint monitoring solution for multicloud enterprise systems is a big deal, especially considering the challenges of agents, security, overhead on continuous monitoring, and false positive scenarios. In a highly distributed system, monitoring just health of service at endpoint isn't sufficient. For instance, the health of an application or service might be good, but the resource used by the application might be unavailable. Every cloud provider has their own agents to monitor their infrastructure and endpoint applications. Given the present situation in the market, there is no single pane of control/solution that's both simple and powerful. In this session, we will demonstrate how to use VMware vRealize Suite in order to monitor endpoints in multicloud (Amazon Web Services, Azure, etc.) and identify patterns with ease. We will also address how to develop customized solutions using vRealize Suite components.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF8465 - Extreme Performance Series: Power Management's Impact on Performance
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Customers are often confused about power management's impact on performance in their environments. In particular, they are concerned about what knobs to set at various levels for their workload—either at the host BIOS level, host OS level, or even the virtual machine level. In certain cases, it may not be clear what knobs to actually enable or disable—for example, OS control mode, high-performance mode, P-states, C-states/package C-states, or Turbo Boost. Just simply disabling all sorts of power management knobs may actually hurt the performance of your workload. It is important to understand the impact of various power management technologies in the latest processors to get the best performance/energy efficiency out of your system. This talk will cover all of the above in detail in addition to the latest power management technologies and their impact on performance. We will show how power management can be controlled from within VMware vSphere's console and how it can benefit your workload in terms of performance and/or performance per watt. We will also talk about what tools to use in order to determine whether your workload is under the influence of power management. Come attend this sesssion to learn more about how you can customize power settings in your vSphere environment.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF8920 - Leveraging Stateless Compute Infrastructure for Centralized Control of the Software-Defined Data Center
PresentationDetailsList.Description: What if you could eliminate the manual efforts typically undertaken to deploy and configure individual VMware ESXi hosts? VMware vSphere Auto Deploy collapses the deployment, patching, and upgrading workflows into one unified procedure. By booting hosts from a designated image directly from the network, vSphere administrators centrally control fleets of compute resources at scale. Host profiles enable configuration management at a cluster level, abstracting away the need to fine-tune hosts one by one. The combination of these two vSphere capabilities results in an operationalized infrastructure that can be managed and kept compliant through policies while reducing overall administrative effort. Learn the benefits of stateless infrastructure, see the capabilities in action, and watch demos of exciting new enhancements on the roadmap.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF9455-SPO - Best Practices for All-Flash Data Reduction Arrays with VMware vSphere
PresentationDetailsList.Description: As All-Flash Data Reduction arrays are becoming common place in VMware environments due to their performance, flexibility and ease-of-use, it is important to understand how to best implement and manage them with ESXi. Data-reduction and flash changes how an administrator should think about various configuration options within VMware and those will be discussed in detail. VAAI, Space Reclamation, virtual disks, SIOC, SDRS, Queue depths, Multipathing and other points will be highlighted.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF8275R - How to Manage Health, Performance, and Capacity of Your Virtualized Data Center Using vSphere with Operations Management
PresentationDetailsList.Description: VMware vSphere with Operations Management is the world's most trusted virtualization and management platform, delivering unprecedented availability, efficiency, and performance for infrastructure and applications. It is designed so you can deliver value to your business from day one, get better insights into your IT environment, and improve efficiency with automation while retaining control. This session will provide details on how you can benefit from vSphere with Operations Management and why you absolutely, positively must have it and will give you a demo of the latest features and capabilities via various scenarios and use cases.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF8553 - The Nuts and Bolts of vSphere Resource Management
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Come and see how VMware vSphere Distributed Resource Scheduler and vR Ops work in tandem to manage VMware vSphere resources at any scale. In this session, we will cover real-world use cases where DRS has worked to ensure your virtual machines are receiving the necessary resources. We will also cover vR Operations Manager WLP and show the best practices when managing multiple vSphere clusters.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF9205R - Troubleshooting vSphere 6 Made Easy: Expert Talk
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Troubleshooting VMware vSphere is always considered a black art, and most of the customers find it challenging when they run into some hurdles. The aim of this session is to provide the customer with a holistic approach for identifying the effects of the problem, defining the troubleshooting scope, and using a structured approach to help overcome these hurdles. The session will also provide exposure to: 1) important and commonly used troubleshooting tools; 2) finding and interpreting relevant log files for specific issues; 3) troubleshooting examples with real-world scenarios; 4) use cases of vSphere Management Assistant and VMware vRealize Log Insight; and 5) proactively involving and exporting appropriate log files to technical support. A troubleshooting guide designed by the experts in global support services will be distributed to customers at the end of the session.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF7578 - A Cloud Service Provider's Success Story: Adoption of vSphere with Operations Management
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Clouditalia's decision to exclusively adopt the VMware cloud stack is still proving a winner. This is in thanks to the integration of products - including direct contact with customers (vCloud Director), management infrastructure (vCenter), and analysis and prediction tools (vRealize Operations and vRealize Log Insight). As a cloud service provider, we must make difficult sizing choices in advance to avoid clipping the wings of those customers who have frequent and rapid expansion needs. vRealize Operations enables us to check the duration of our investment. We can review the medium- to long-term future by comparing revenues from this extension, without having to exaggerate or underrate them. Using this tool to analyze the root cause gives us the opportunity to optimize structure and stop repeating mistakes that lead to anything from individual customer outages to global outages. Last, but certainly not least, is optimization. Thanks to vRealize Operations, we are able to better communicate with our customers. This provides us with needed data so we can confidently notify customers who are wasting resources as well as those who are underpowered. Clouditalia owes much of its success to the ability to attend to every customer, regardless of the size of his or her business. Much of the credit is due to vSphere with Operations Management. Customers recognize this value in Clouditalia and appreciate that, unlike with other larger groups, they aren't treated in "default mode" as a mere number.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: MGT7878 - Using vRealize Suite for Endpoint Monitoring in a Multicloud Environment
PresentationDetailsList.Description: An endpoint monitoring solution for multicloud enterprise systems is a big deal, especially considering the challenges of agents, security, overhead on continuous monitoring, and false positive scenarios. In a highly distributed system, monitoring just health of service at endpoint isn't sufficient. For instance, the health of an application or service might be good, but the resource used by the application might be unavailable. Every cloud provider has their own agents to monitor their infrastructure and endpoint applications. Given the present situation in the market, there is no single pane of control/solution that's both simple and powerful. In this session, we will demonstrate how to use VMware vRealize Suite in order to monitor endpoints in multicloud (Amazon Web Services, Azure, etc.) and identify patterns with ease. We will also address how to develop customized solutions using vRealize Suite components.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF8663 - The Making of a Legend-Dairy Software-Defined Data Center
PresentationDetailsList.Description: We've realized the benefits of a software-defined data center ... and you can too! Join this session to learn how Land O'Lakes, a member-owned agricultural cooperative operating in 50 states and more than 50 countries, transformed its legacy data center with software-defined infrastructure, VMware vSphere 6, and the VMware vRealize suite of solutions. You'll also learn how this enabled the Land O'Lakes IT Department to manage the company's ever-increasing growth while lowering TCO, streamlining operations, and ensuring efficient and reliable data protection and high availability. Thanks to its data-center-in-a-box approach to standardizing IT across Land O'Lakes' distributed sites and leveraging the vRealize suite of solutions, this Fortune 200 company can more easily manage its ever-growing infrastructure.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF8260 - Automated Deployment and Configuration of the vCenter Server Appliance
PresentationDetailsList.Description: In this session, you will get a brief introduction to the VMware vCenter Server Appliance and some of the new deployment concepts that were introduced in VMware vSphere 6.0 and later. Customers will then learn how to automate the deployment of the vCenter Server Appliance, including the initial deployment and configuration. We will also be exploring tools and methods to help you automate some of the day-two operations with the vCenter Server Appliance after deployment. Lastly, we will provide an early sneak peek of how you can easily manage, configure, and monitor your vCenter Server Appliance in the future and leverage the next-gen vSphere API.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF8850 - vSphere Platform Security
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Security of the VMware vSphere platform has become one of the most popular topics at VMworld in the past couple of years. This session will introduce attendees to the authentication changes that have been made in vSphere 6 update 2 and provide a technology preview of new security features, including disk encryption, SecureBoot for hosts and guests, and hypervisor architecture updates.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF9944R - What's New with vCenter Server
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Attend this session to learn the latest with vCenter Server, with a special focus on the vCenter Server Appliance. We'll provide an overview of the features available in vCenter Server with the vSphere 6.0 Update 2 release. We will also show tech previews of exciting new capabilities coming in the future for vCenter Server.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF8780R - vSphere Core 4 Performance Troubleshooting and Root Cause Analysis, Part 1: CPU and RAM
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Is your virtual guest experiencing performance problems? In this two-part session, we will explore the proper tools to diagnose the problem in real time, whether it's CPU, RAM, disk, or network resources. We will also teach you how to use ESXTOP and the VMware vSphere Web client to determine whether your issues exist at the virtual guest layer, the VMware ESXi host layer, or the physical resource layer. Part 1 will focus on intrahost compute resources (CPU and RAM). Part 2 will focus on I/O resources (disk and network) and how to determine if storage issues are inside or outside of your ESXi host. Session content is based in part on questions heard most often from vSphere administrators via the VMware training team.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: MGT8439 - Lessons Learned from EMC IT's Data Center Evolution
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Virtualization is an enabler to agility, but automation is the key to unlocking its full potential. This session will give an overview of the case study on how EMC IT has transformed its infrastructure from Highly Virtualized to Highly Automated in order to reduce costs and streamline service delivery.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF8277-QT - Dear IT, You Can Be a Strategic Partner to Your Business. Let me help. Yours Truly, vSphere with Operations Management.
PresentationDetailsList.Description: This session helps IT practitioners, managers, and directors to figure out the specific steps they can take to move IT from being just a cost center to a truly strategic partner for their business. The session provides details on specific steps IT needs to take and how VMware vSphere with Operations Management can help in this transformation.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF8558-QT - Business Value of Data Center Virtualization and Hybrid Cloud Extensibility
PresentationDetailsList.Description: IT organizations today are being challenged to help acquire and retain customers, enable innovative business models, and deliver faster time-to-market for products and services. To meet these growing demands and help people to start viewing IT as a business partner and not just a service provider, IT organizations are focused on delivering unique capabilities and value. In this session, we will provide an overview of the key trends that are affecting virtualization today. We'll also take a look at how VMware's products and technologies enable you to achieve lower CapEx and manage business growth while providing hardware choice, security, flexibility, and extensibility to the hybrid cloud without ripping and replacing your existing hardware.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF8516-QT - VMware Security: The Whole Is Greater than the Sum of Parts
PresentationDetailsList.Description: VM Security Fabric extends across vSphere to all other VMware products providing a secure layer for your data center. VMware products share identity, encryption, audit logging and leverage the great new security features that are being released in vSphere 6.0U2 and tech preview.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF7764-QT - Has the Hypervisor Been Commoditized?
PresentationDetailsList.Description: One of the most hotly debated subjects in IT today is whether or not the hypervisor has been commoditized. With a slowing global economy, businesses and organizations of all sizes are tightening IT budgets, forcing the question of whether or not they should migrate completely to a platform that is open source or included with an OS that they already own or one that is able to run multiple hypervisors. For example, mission-critical apps deserve the most stable and mature platform, while less important environments like labs or branch offices can get away with the "free" solution. Because the hypervisor is truly the foundation and first step toward building any Software-Defined Data Center (SDDC)/hybrid cloud—or even the public cloud for that matter—the importance of this decision cannot be understated. In this session, we will have an honest talk about the current discussions surrounding hypervisor commoditization and motivators towards running multiple solutions, or all-out migration. We will discuss what other offerings are out there and the advantages and disadvantages of each. We'll also dive into why the hypervisor is so fundamentally important to the success of any SDDC/hybrid cloud and how VMware vSphere is the best solution both technically and financially. Last, we'll uncover the true costs and complexities of running multiple hypervisors and why it usually doesn't make sense to do so.
